message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.CL 

This paper deals with performance evaluation of computer vision models using rank-based metrics, which are commonly used in computer vision tasks such as image retrieval and object detection. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also presents a method for differentiating rank-based metrics with mini-batch gradient descent, which falls under the category of optimization and machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely category. The paper also addresses optimization instability and sparsity of the supervision signal, which are common issues in information retrieval (cs.IR) and multimedia (cs.MM) tasks. Finally, the paper applies the resulting losses to image retrieval and object detection tasks, which are also relevant to natural language processing (cs.CL) tasks such as image captioning and visual question answering.
